Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie77
Reviews.Content: Toronto is an expensive city for accomodation, and this university residence is a total bargain. Of course, you'll get a basic comfort, with shared bathrooms, but the room is really OK. On the other hand, you will benefit from the common area equipments, which include a shared fridge, microwave oven, etc. What's more, the location is top-notch, right smack in the city centre. Oh, and: there's Wifi! :)

Reviews.Title: “$265 CAD for Seven Days Lodging (includes 13% Tax)”
Reviews.Author: BrockDaBadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the long-term Wetmore Hall Residence for one week in August 2011. Basic room with pillow, sheets, blanket and bedspread; desk with chair; and telephone included but mine didn't work. Very economical accommodations in a very expensive city. Laundry machines were $1 per load and $0.50 to dry. Breakfast buffet was available while I was there but can be sporadic depending if there are large groups staying on campus. Right across from Spadina trolley line and a 5 minute walk to subway ($3 CAD with transfers).

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for is what you get”
Reviews.Author: gracelimme
Reviews.Content: Saved much on accomodation during this trip. Bare necessities were provided. Security was sufficient for a lone traveller. Could rest well. If you're looking for a luxurious place to satisfy creature comforts. this is not the place to be..

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: devotchka83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights over a weekend. I booked the residences because I was last-minute and it was one of the few places with availability. I was apprehensive of partying with it being a weekend, but the place quieted right down at midnight, so no problems there. My room was fine, clean and given I had a double to myself I had plenty of space. The free wi-fi was completely reliable. The shared bathrooms, however, weren't cleaned once in the three days I was there, even though they needed it (particularly the sinks). I didn't use the common areas so I can't comment on them. The staff are really helpful. The location and price are the main things going for this place. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: professorjackson
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and spartan, as I expected. The toilets and shower down the hall were almost disgusting, but not quite. Let's just say it was clear many people used them both frequently. All of this was as I expected, given the incredible price of $40 per night. And the location is incredibly convenient for downtown. The Spadina street car is very closeby. I needed to leave a day earlier than expected, not an emergency but a change of plans. They would not even consider refunding all or part of my final night's fee.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably cold and shoddy”
Reviews.Author: borealistraveller
Reviews.Content: A bad hostel type accomodation. The main complaint was the central air conditioning system - it can't be turned off or down. At night, wrapped in 3 layers and 3 blankets, I was freezing. The bathrooms on the floor I stayed on had water fixtures falling out of walls, sheets of paint peeling off and light fixtures falling out of their sockets in the showers. It might be cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet budget accommodation in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: purplecazz
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here after reading reviews on other websites, as we wanted somewhere cheap to get a good night's sleep ready for exploring the next day. This is two student residences, open to the public during the summer holidays. As such, the rooms were large, with shared bathrooms - great for us as we didn't have to share a bathroom! Also security was better than with hostel accomodation. It was a bonus having access to a common room with a fridge and TV. There is a choice of single or twin rooms, and our rooms were very clean. You can book via hostelling websites, but we found that you can book directly with the college and then get student discount. The buffet breakfast included in the price was extensive and pretty good quality. The location was good, close to Spadina station and the tram line. It was great as a quiet base for exploring, but not a lot going on if you want accommodation with action.

HotelInfo.Name: University of Toronto - New College Residences
HotelInfo.Address: 40 Willcocks Street, Toronto, Ontario M5S1C6, Canada
